name: The Victoria Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was in a perfect location: near the coast and the shops. From the moment we arrived, we were made so welcome. The rooms were spotless and we had a beautiful balcony. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were very quiet at night. We had a choice of three pools: two outdoor and one indoor. I thought this was fantastic! There was even a pool bar on the top floor with fantastic service. The spa offered really cheap treatments. We also had lots of choice in where we ate dinner at night. Even when we were checking out, the reception staff were so nice. Highly recommended!!
reviews.title: Wonderful staff!

reviews.text: I arrived at 4am and was put into a lovely room with a balcony that overlooked The Gorg Borg Olivier Street, which made me feel very much part of the environment that I had come to see and explore. Not noisy at all, even though a street down to the ocean. People across the road had a dinner party one night and so it was nice to know I was amongst the normal population as well. I was about 4 minutes walk to the promenade and the ocean...with all the restaurants and buses easily accessible. My room was spacious and the linen fresh and clean, and every day my room was cleaned and very clean at that. The bathroom was always fresh and was a good size too. I loved the oldness of the hotel, and although older was well maintained. I was well-treated by all, and rate this hotel highly, and I am quite a particular person, especially when it comes to cleanliness and good manners. In-room dining was great.
reviews.title: Loved my stay :)

reviews.text: Everything great from the warm welcome to the friendly good bye - a real change from the plastic USA-type service ( missing you already!) you get in so many hotels - staff always there to help - front desk always manned - room sevice prompt - oh and rooms were clean too - slightly old world atmosphere to the place which only added to the charm. Only issue was trying to use the sauna/ steam room but this was due to contractual problems with the leisure facility operators and not directly the the hotels fault..
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.text: This hotel is great, we couldn't fault it. The staff are fantastic so nice and helpful from the guys on the desk, to the ladies cleaning the room you only had to ask and they would fall over themselves to get it for you.
reviews.title: hotel staff couldn't do enough for you, they are what make this hotel great

reviews.text: The rooms are a little basic for a four star but the service is five star which personally i think is more important!! The rooms are clean and tidy and we had a balcony which was great. You could also use the swimming pool of the five star sister hotel right next door which is linked through the hotel itself, this was amazing and the food at the pool was really good too. Even the guys working at the pool were so helpful, they were having a laugh and a joke with some of the children which i'm sure is not part of there job description!
reviews.title: Great staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Victoria Hotel was located in a quiet street and the staff were always pleasant and very helpfull. The location it self was also good in close walking distace to restaurant areas, shopping and rocky beach areas. I think we had one of the "old" rooms (after what I understood steaking to other guests). The room was on the 2nd floor and it was really big, but had kind of the "old" smell, which I guess is partly caused by the humidity..! We got used to it anyway. There was also a balcony with a good size that we didn't use for the intended purpuse, but more for drying clothes/bathing suits. The great thing about this hotel is it's connection with the neighbour hotel! Which in fact means you can use one great pool area!! This is a lovely place to sunbade and maybe have a lunch. A fitness center is also available, and is weel equipped for a one week vacation workout. We had the breakfast buffet every morning, it had a great variety in choices and nice eating area. The hotel offers dinners every night - and we went there one of the nights and it was to us a fairly good deal.
reviews.title: Smart choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this hotel after checking reviews on tripadvisor. Although there were some negative comments(which you get at almost every hotel) we felt the positive comments far outweighed the bad. This was a very special occasion for us as a couple as we were in fact getting married during the holiday.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel we will be back soon

reviews.text: On arrival there was a small mix up with the hotel room we had booked and we were allocated a suite that is not advertised on the hotel website. I was a little dissapointed by this but the front office Manager Mr C Portelli was fantastic and sorted this issue out for us with very little fuss.
reviews.title: Just got back & wishing i was still there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This aside i have to say that this is one of the best hotels we have stayed in (and there have been many) yes the decor is a little tired in places but it really wasnt nearly as bad as some people say on these reviews. The suite we were given was huge with a large double balcony with a lovely sea view. The staff were very friendly and very very helpful especially the front of house reception staff.
reviews.title: Another pleasant stay at the Victoria
fabulous week, can't wait to return
reviews.text: The food was the best we have had in a hotel and we would really recommend the half board option as the variety was amazingly good value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, everyone spoke good english.
reviews.title: We had a very relaxing time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was big with a large balcony big enough for two people to sit outside in comfort, the style of room was ok. The hotel has 3 pools , i didn't expect them to be so good, they were very clean and well maintained. The large pool area had good views and was a great place to swim before breakfast, very easy to just laze around all day as you can get good food and drinks so you wouldn't have to move. The hotel was a short walk to the seafront and the ferries which has a bus terminus, depending if you take a lift or right turn out of the hotel , it was close to resturants, bars and the point shopping center and plaza. Something for everyone. What i liked best was the pools and liked least was paying 5 eruo per hour for the internet, it should be free for a hotel of this grade
reviews.title: Definately we loved it and we'll be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The moment we entered the hotel, we could feel the hospitality from the front desk, especially from Mr. Charles Portelli. Our room was marvelous. The staff was very kind and helpfull. Although the hotel is located in the centre of Sliema, one could go for a walk by the seaside, which is on 3 minutes away from the hotel. The hotel is close to shops, restaurants and public transportation.
reviews.title: 19th century charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recommend this hotel for cleanliness and hospitality.
reviews.title: Cool, quiet retreat in noisy, busy Sliema
HOW TO SURVIVE "THE VICTORIA"
reviews.text: We booked this through a travel website as part of a package and enjoyed the stay in this slice of Victoriana. This is a great hotel in principle, and we loved it, but they need to work on a few areas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our twentieth visit to The Victoria Hotel in Sliema Malta since July 2005, this says a lot about this hotel. We have been travelling to Malta for the past 23 years and only ever went once a year for two weeks in July, since we discovered The Victoria Hotel and everything it has to offer we now visit three times a year – we even went four times in 2008.
reviews.title: "Great stay once again"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: During our recent stay we saw several familiar faces of people who also frequent this hotel year after year which proves what we have always said you are always treated as a potential return guest, this is because no-one would return to somewhere if they had not been looked after in the best possible way.
reviews.title: Very helpful and friendly staff

reviews.text: Breakfast and evening meals are both buffet offering a variety of items at breakfast from cereal, fruit and yogurt, cold meats and cheese and cooked items including bacon, sausage, beans, mushrooms, eggs etc and a variety of bread – something for everyone. Evening buffet offers soup, pasta dish, salad bar, choice of mains two meats and a fish choice and then there is the dessert table offering several different desserts along with fruit salad and cheese and biscuits, Al a carte is also available.
reviews.title: warm welcome

reviews.text: The rooms have a fridge and tea & coffee making facilities, TV and safe and the bathrooms have a hair dryer. There are two pools one on the eighth floor of The Victoria and the other on the ninth floor of its sister hotel The Palace which is accessible via the seventh floor of The Victoria, both pool areas offer fantastic views. The seventh floor also houses an indoor pool and a gym.
reviews.title: Nice Quiet Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You are always met with a smile from the reception staff whenever you enter or leave the hotel, and the staff in The Copperfield’s restaurant are so friendly, nothing is too much trouble for them. A great hotel is not just having a decent bedroom and good food but also good staff to look after you which The Victoria has in every department, the staff cannot do enough for you, they are friendly and polite whilst professional at the same time.
reviews.title: nice people great facilities and CHEAP
